message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about food safety and the importance of cooking meat thoroughly. To safely eat meat, it is necessary to boost its temperature through cooking. Cooking meat at a high enough temperature kills bacteria and other pathogens that may be present, reducing the risk of foodborne illnesses. Option (B) is incorrect because raising its kids has no connection to food safety. Option (C) is unrelated and not a common practice in food preparation. Option (D) is also incorrect because lowering the temperature of meat would not make it safe to eat.

This question requires basic knowledge about food safety and the preparation of meat. In order to safely eat meat, it needs to be cooked to a certain temperature to kill any potential bacteria or pathogens present. Option (A) is the correct answer because you need to boost or increase the temperature of the meat to ensure it is cooked through. Option (B) is incorrect because raising the kids of the meat is not relevant to food safety. Option (C) is a nonsensical option as ice does not need to be heated. Option (D) is incorrect because lowering the temperature of the meat would not ensure it is cooked safely.
